info.title: ConsumptionManagementClient
info.description: Consumption management client provides access to consumption resources for Azure Enterprise Subscriptions.

MeterDetails.description: The properties of the meter detail.

meterName.description: The name of the meter, within the given meter category

meterCategory.description: The category of the meter, for example, 'Cloud services', 'Networking', etc..

meterSubCategory.description: The subcategory of the meter, for example, 'A6 Cloud services', 'ExpressRoute (IXP)', etc..

unit.description: The unit in which the meter consumption is charged, for example, 'Hours', 'GB', etc.

meterLocation.description: The location in which the Azure service is available.

totalIncludedQuantity.description: The total included quantity associated with the offer.

UsageDetailsListResult.description: Result of listing usage details. It contains a list of available usage details in reverse chronological order by billing period.

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

UsageDetailProperties.description: The properties of the usage detail.

billingPeriodId.description: The id of the billing period resource that the usage belongs to.

invoiceId.description: The id of the invoice resource that the usage belongs to.

usageStart.description: The start of the date time range covered by the usage detail.

usageEnd.description: The end of the date time range covered by the usage detail.

instanceName.description: The name of the resource instance that the usage is about.

instanceId.description: The uri of the resource instance that the usage is about.

instanceLocation.description: The location of the resource instance that the usage is about.

currency.description: The ISO currency in which the meter is charged, for example, USD.

pretaxCost.description: The amount of cost before tax.

isEstimated.description: The estimated usage is subject to change.

meterDetails.description: The details about the meter. By default this is not populated, unless it's specified in $expand.

costCenter.description: The cost center of this department if it is a department and a costcenter exists

additionalProperties.description: Additional details of this usage item. By default this is not populated, unless it's specified in $expand.

MarketplacesListResult.description: Result of listing marketplaces. It contains a list of available marketplaces in reverse chronological order by billing period.

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

MarketplaceProperties.description: The properties of the marketplace usage detail.

billingPeriodId.description: The id of the billing period resource that the usage belongs to.

usageStart.description: The start of the date time range covered by the usage detail.

usageEnd.description: The end of the date time range covered by the usage detail.

instanceName.description: The name of the resource instance that the usage is about.

instanceId.description: The uri of the resource instance that the usage is about.

currency.description: The ISO currency in which the meter is charged, for example, USD.

pretaxCost.description: The amount of cost before tax.

isEstimated.description: The estimated usage is subject to change.

costCenter.description: The cost center of this department if it is a department and a costcenter exists

additionalProperties.description: Additional details of this usage item. By default this is not populated, unless it's specified in $expand.

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

ReservationSummariesProperties.description: The properties of the reservation summaries.

reservationOrderId.description: The reservation order ID is the identifier for a reservation purchase. Each reservation order ID represents a single purchase transaction. A reservation order contains reservations. The reservation order specifies the VM size and region for the reservations.

reservationId.description: The reservation ID is the identifier of a reservation within a reservation order. Each reservation is the grouping for applying the benefit scope and also specifies the number of instances to which the reservation benefit can be applied to.

skuName.description: This is the ARM Sku name. It can be used to join with the servicetype field in additoinalinfo in usage records.

reservedHours.description: This is the total hours reserved. E.g. if reservation for 1 instance was made on 1 PM, this will be 11 hours for that day and 24 hours from subsequent days

usageDate.description: Data corresponding to the utilization record. If the grain of data is monthly, it will be first day of month.

usedHours.description: Total used hours by the reservation

minUtilizationPercentage.description: This is the minimum hourly utilization in the usage time (day or month). E.g. if usage record corresponds to 12/10/2017 and on that for hour 4 and 5, utilization was 10%, this field will return 10% for that day

avgUtilizationPercentage.description: This is average utilization for the entire time range. (day or month depending on the grain)

maxUtilizationPercentage.description: This is the maximum hourly utilization in the usage time (day or month). E.g. if usage record corresponds to 12/10/2017 and on that for hour 4 and 5, utilization was 100%, this field will return 100% for that day.

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

ReservationRecommendationsProperties.description: The properties of the reservation recommendations.

lookBackPeriod.description: The number of days of usage to look back for recommendations.

term.description: RI recommendations in one or three year terms.

costWithNoReservedInstances.description: The total amount of cost without reserved instances.

totalCostWithReservedInstances.description: The total amount of cost with reserved instances.

netSavings.description: Total estimated savings with reserved instances.

firstUsageDate.description: The usage date for looking back.

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

ReservationDetailsProperties.description: The properties of the reservation details.

reservationOrderId.description: The reservation order ID is the identifier for a reservation purchase. Each reservation order ID represents a single purchase transaction. A reservation order contains reservations. The reservation order specifies the VM size and region for the reservations.

reservationId.description: The reservation ID is the identifier of a reservation within a reservation order. Each reservation is the grouping for applying the benefit scope and also specifies the number of instances to which the reservation benefit can be applied to.

skuName.description: This is the ARM Sku name. It can be used to join with the servicetype field in additoinalinfo in usage records.

reservedHours.description: This is the total hours reserved for the day. E.g. if reservation for 1 instance was made on 1 PM, this will be 11 hours for that day and 24 hours from subsequent days.

usageDate.description: The date on which consumption occurred.

usedHours.description: This is the total hours used by the instance.

instanceId.description: This identifier is the name of the resource or the fully qualified Resource ID.

totalReservedQuantity.description: This is the total count of instances that are reserved for the reservationid.

BudgetsListResult.description: Result of listing budgets. It contains a list of available budgets in the scope provided.

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

category.description: The category of the budget, whether the budget tracks cost or usage.

amount.description: The total amount of cost to track with the budget

timeGrain.description: The time covered by a budget. Tracking of the amount will be reset based on the time grain.

timePeriod.description: Has start and end date of the budget. The start date must be first of the month and should be less than the end date. Budget start date must be on or after June 1, 2017. Future start date should not be more than three months. Past start date should  be selected within the timegrain preiod. There are no restrictions on the end date.

filters.description: May be used to filter budgets by resource group, resource, or meter.

currentSpend.description: The current amount of cost which is being tracked for a budget.

notifications.description: Dictionary of notifications associated with the budget. Budget can have up to five notifications.

BudgetTimePeriod.description: The start and end date for a budget.

startDate.description: The start date for the budget.

endDate.description: The end date for the budget. If not provided, we default this to 10 years from the start date.

Filters.description: May be used to filter budgets by resource group, resource, or meter.

resourceGroups.description: The list of filters on resource groups, allowed at subscription level only.

resources.description: The list of filters on resources.

meters.description: The list of filters on meters (GUID), mandatory for budgets of usage category.

tags.description: The dictionary of filters on tags.

CurrentSpend.description: The current amount of cost which is being tracked for a budget.

amount.description: The total amount of cost which is being tracked by the budget.

unit.description: The unit of measure for the budget amount.

Notification.description: The notification associated with a budget.

enabled.description: The notification is enabled or not.

threshold.description: Threshold value associated with a notification. Notification is sent when the cost exceeded the threshold. It is always percent and has to be between 0 and 1000.

contactEmails.description: Email addresses to send the budget notification to when the threshold is exceeded.

contactRoles.description: Contact roles to send the budget notification to when the threshold is exceeded.

contactGroups.description: Action groups to send the budget notification to when the threshold is exceeded.

CostTagProperties.description: The properties of the cost tag.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

ErrorResponse.description: Error response indicates that the service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: UsageDetail, etc.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

OperationListResult.description: Result of listing consumption operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of consumption operations supported by the Microsoft.Consumption resource provider.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

eTag.description: eTag of the resource. To handle concurrent update scenarion, this field will be used to determine whether the user is updating the latest version or not.

PriceSheetModel.description: price sheet result. It contains the pricesheet associated with billing period

nextLink.description: The link (url) to the next page of results.

PriceSheetProperties.description: The properties of the price sheet.

billingPeriodId.description: The id of the billing period resource that the usage belongs to.

meterDetails.description: The details about the meter. By default this is not populated, unless it's specified in $expand.

parameters.$filter: properties/usageEnd ge '2018-01-14' AND properties/usageEnd le '2018-02-14' AND tags eq 'dev:tools'

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-03-31.
